summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, notifying colleagues of travel to Pensacola to interview Jeffrey Epstein's former houseman. The interview is part of the ongoing investigation into Epstein.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, traveling to interview Epstein's former houseman as part of the investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose former houseman from the 1990s through 2002 is being interviewed by prosecutors.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The prosecutor is investigating Epstein, as evidenced by the travel to interview a former employee of Epstein.

events.title: Travel to interview Epstein's houseman
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney and another individual (MI) travel to Pensacola to interview Jeffrey Epstein's former houseman.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors from the Southern District of New York were actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein as of February 2020.
The investigation involved interviewing a former houseman of Epstein who worked for him from the 1990s through 2002.
The interview was scheduled to take place in Pensacola.
The email indicates coordination and travel by law enforcement for witness interviews.
